thread.title: Victoria Beckham joins mourners at Franca Sozzani's memorial service
thread.title_full: Victoria Beckham joins mourners at Franca Sozzani's memorial service

title: Victoria Beckham joins mourners at Franca Sozzani's memorial service
text:
Naomi Campbell 
Victoria Beckham joined a number of famous faces from the fashion world to pay tribute to Franca Sozzani at a public memorial service on Monday. The fashion designer looked downcast in a navy dress and shades as she left the ceremony hosted in honour of the late Vogue Italia editor during Milan Fashion Week. 
STORY: Franca Sozzani has passed away at the age of 66 
Franca's friends and peers turned out in their droves at Milan's Duomo Cathedral to pay tribute following her death from a year-long illness in December. Among them were Naomi Campbell and Kate Moss, who arrived arm-in-arm with fashion designer Stella McCartney. Meanwhile Rita Ora also attended the service, and later shared a photo on Instagram, writing: "Honouring Franca Sozzani and her legacy today in Milan." CLICK TO VIEW GALLERY Victoria Beckham joined mourners at the memorial for Franca Sozzani 
In testament to Franca's extensive career editing the fashion magazine for 28 years, she was remembered by a number of the world's biggest fashion designers including Valentino, Giorgio Armani and Miuccia Prada. 
STORY: Victoria Beckham leads tributes to Franca Sozzani 
Franca passed away on 22 December at the age of 66, with her death prompting an outpouring of grief from the fashion world. At the time Victoria said she had been "mesmerised" after spending time with the fashion editor in a touching Instagram post. Sharing a photo of herself and Franca together, Victoria wrote: "I had the privilege of spending time with Franca over the years. Not enough now as it sadly transpires. Whenever I was with her I was mesmerised by her strength of character, her charitable work, her creative vision. "She encouraged me and inspired me whenever we spoke. What a legacy she leaves behind. RIP @francasozzani1. x VB." Kate Moss and Naomi Campbell also attended the service 
Other stars to express their sadness following Franca's passing included Jessica Alba, who wrote: "The incredibly warm, intelligent, witty, fierce and rebellious #francasozzani will be missed..." Meanwhile Jourdan Dunn thanked Franca for helping to launch her career when she was a teenager. What do you think?
